Articles.Content: What is your favorite and least favorite planet and why? ( or most interesting/ least interesting if you prefer)
Eve cuz it's purple, and Eve cuz it's so hard to get off of.

In the kerbal toy? Or just in general. In kerbal toy, Jool. It represents a fraction of the potential power and mystery that sums up the universe. In general? I would have to say Iego, over a thousand moons, and nearly impossible to get to.

Favorite? Duna has fairly low gravity and an atmosphere so parachutes aren't COMPLETELY useless.

Least favorite? Kerbin. It's so freaking oppressive.

My favourite planet is Kerbin, because i keep imagining what it might look like one day when it has cities and weather among other sights, my least favourite is probably Dres, it looks like a moon, has no moons of it's own and frankly feels like it's taking up valuable real-estate where something a little more interesting could have existed in it's place.

Favorite: Tie between Duna and Kerbin and Laythe. Can't wait to see what they become.

Least favorite: Eve. It's so... Boring. And purple. And hard to get off of. Aaaaa.

Favorite: jool because of all the awesome moons!

Least favorite: Moho blows up all my ships!

Least Fav: Kerbin - that's why I keep trying to leave

Most Fav: Duna, if you look at my ribbons that's as far as I've been.

Fav: Jool, even though I've never been, all the moons...

Least fav: Kerbin, boring stinkhole!

My least favorite is Dres, never been there and it is fairly low down my list of things to do in the game.

My favorite is Jool just because of all the stuff you can do there.

Favorite: Duna, because it's a cool and relatively easy place to get to and leave.

Least Favorite: Eve, because it looks friendly from the outside when in reality is a terrible place.

Most awesome - Laythe

Most horrible - Moho

Least appreciated - Kerbin (closely followed by Vall)

Most overlooked - Tylo

Most boring - Dres

Most fun - Gilly

Most forgettable - Minmus
I like Laythe the most, because it's a "habitable" moon orbiting a gas giant, and I like the concept. My least favourite is probably Moho, as there's nothing interesting there.

My least favorite is Dres, never been there and it is fairly low down my list of things to do in the game.

My favorite is Jool just because of all the stuff you can do there.

Most overlooked - Tylo

Most boring - Dres

Exploring the ravine on Dres with a rover was one of the most fun i had in KSP.

(Also seconded on underrated Tylo )

I'm liking all the planets but if i had to choose...

Like: Kerbin, for all the interesting places you can go in planes and retelling the story of bringing the man to space. And also Eve for being so hard

Dislike: Laythe, for being so plain while allowing jet powered fight, and (new) Moho for lack of awesome atmosphere it had.

Edited May 22, 2013 by Nao

Favorite: Laythe

Least Favorite: Minmus
My favourites are Minmus and Eve, least favourite is probably Duna, or any of the moons that aren't Laythe (or Minmus, obviously).

My least favourite is probably Moho, as there's nothing interesting there.

Go to either pole, you'll find something interesting.

I like Jool the most, since the Jool system is interesting. Eve is the worst, since you can't get off it easily, and there's nothing to see.

Edited May 22, 2013 by TheDarkStar

Favorite : Laythe

Least fav: moho

Favourite - Probably Duna simply because i love the mars analog.

Least Favourite - Dres, Nothing interesting to do there.

Dres, Nothing interesting to do there.

There's an extremely deep canyon to explore.

Farovite: Duna. Quite easy to both go there and leave.

Least favorite: Moho. Not sure why. I have just never felt like going there

Favorite: Duna, since it's far enough away to be interesting but close and hospitable enough to do all sorts of fun missions.

Least Favorite: Jool, because all-in-one-launch missions are a lot more limited (I can easily dock in orbit, I just haven't had the patience lately) in the scope of what they can accomplish. All the cool things I want to do like a Laythe base and multiple rovers/orbiters require a lot more time and effort.

Favorite is Duna; I just love how it is easy to land on, easy to take off, has my favorite Artifact, the most enigmatic easter egg, is tidally locked to its moon, and Ike has one of the coolest Easter Eggs EVER!

Least favorite: Don't have one yet

I've been almost everywhere, except Tylo and Eeloo.

My favorite is Duna, it's close, it has a big nice moon, the gravity is low but not too much, the atmosphere is allowing aerobraking. It reminds me Mars of course, but I also think about it as Arrakis (Dune) analog.

My least favorite is Dres, I've only been there once, and its SOI is so small that it's such a pain to get captured by it!

Favourite, Vall, because I absolutely adore the scenery ( the other muns) (and I dislike ponces who ponce around laythe in their poncy planes)

Least favorite: Ike, Gurrrrrrrrrr, stupid Ike, always getting the way of my Duna aerobraking
